parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From epi and timao; to tax upon, i.e. Censure or admonish; by implication, forbid.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To keep silence, be silent, either voluntarily or involuntarily. From siope; to be dumb; figuratively, to be calm.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To cry aloud, shriek. A primary verb; properly, to 'croak' or scream, i.e. to call aloud.
More, rather. Neuter of the comparative of the same as malista; more) or rather.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
David, King of Israel. Of Hebrew origin; Dabid, the Israelite king.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To pity, have mercy on. From eleos; to compassionate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
